branches.Clients: Women experiencing severe disadvantage during pregnancy, birth and early parenting (mental health, substance misuse, domestic and sexual violence, trafficking, detention and human rights violations overseas)
branches.Process: takes referrals from agencies. A woman may also refer herself, managed by Community Link co-ordinator.
branches.Services: community: birth plans/support during birth.Targeted antenatal classes in Hackney – by referral only, Thursdays. Weekly visits to Peterborough and Bronzefield prisons to offer support to pregnant women and new mothers

branches.Clients: Pregnant women living in Newham or Tower Hamlets who do not have a suitable support network, or have specific needs or healthcare issues
branches.Process: Women can be referred after the 5th month of pregnancy up until the baby is 6 to 12 weeks old. Referral form on website
branches.Services: practical and emotional support to women during pregnancy, childbirth and the early weeks of motherhood
